isis.stitle: AFC 98901 - Bendix AD-9 Air Dryer Upgrade

lev1.title: General
lev1.para: This AFC applies to all models with Holset (Cummins) type EOVEQ compressor built between October 1, 1996 and December 31, 1997.
The Bendix AD-9 air dryer could malfunction if the purge valve becomes blocked. An upgraded purge valve assembly is available which eliminates the possibility of valve blockage.
The new assembly is designed to improve performance and extend the service life of the AD-9 air dryer purge valve assembly mechanism. It includes the following improvements:

item.para: A heavier purge piston return spring to ensure positive return of the piston and better sealing of the purge valve.
A modified piston and seal combination for improved sealing at higher temperatures.

lev1.title: Identification
lev1.para: All AD-9 air dryers manufactured or remanufactured after December 31, 1997, incorporate the new purge valve assembly. Air dryers with the new purge valve assembly can be identified in one of two ways.

note.para: AD-9 air dryers manufactured or remanufactured with date codes between K0196T or F (October 1, 1996) and M3197T or F (December 31, 1997) should be upgraded to the new purge valve assembly ( Figure 1).

The first letter of the date code is the month, A=January, B=February, etc. The first pair of digits is the day while the second pair of digits is the year. The last letter indicates the plant location.

item.para: The date code will be L0197F or later.
Visually inspect for the presence of a white paint marking or green disk on the purge valve assembly ( Figure 2). If either is found no repair is necessary.

note.para: This procedure does not require removal of the Bendix AD-9 air dryer.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a level surface and prevent movement by setting the parking brakes and blocking the vehicle.

warning.para: Whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent it from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Drain all air reservoirs to 0 PSI.

warning.para: Drain off all air from the air system before removing brake system components. Failure to do so could result in personal injury and/or death.

step1.para: Clean the exterior of the air dryer end cover.
Remove the three self tapping screws that secure the purge valve assembly to the end cover.
Clean the bores in the dryer end cover.
Lubricate the dryer end cover bores and the outside surface of the purge valve assembly with the grease provided. Make certain the O-rings have been coated with lubricant.
Install the new purge valve assembly in the end cover while making certain the purge valve is fully seated against the end cover.
Install the three self tapping screws which retain the purge valve assembly. Tighten the screws to 85 to 125 in-lbs.

Close all reservoir drain cocks. Start the engine to build up system air pressure and note that the AD-9 air dryer purges air with an audible escape of air. Exercise the service brake pedal to reduce the system air pressure to governor cut-in. Verify that the air system regains full air pressure and the air dryer purges air audibly.

Apply a soap solution around the purge valve in the air dryer end cover and surrounding area of the purge valve. Leakage should not exceed a 1 inch bubble in 1 second. If leakage exceeds specification, remove and re-install the purge valve assembly. If leakage continues, replace the air dryer assembly.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

entry.para: Replace air dryer purge valve assembly

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-98901.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-98901 activity must be submitted by March 31, 1999, or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after March 31, 1999.
